intro: Helipterum cotula var. ramosissimum, commonly known as the clustered helipterum, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm. The plant features small, bright yellow flowers arranged in dense clusters, which bloom from late winter to early spring. Its leaves are linear to lanceolate, with a rough texture and a tendency to branch profusely, giving it a bushy appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open habitats such as roadsides and disturbed areas.
